segments.text: I see the water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely clueless about what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy is about to fall, and his sister doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the stool is so wobbly—it looks like it’s about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at them to stop before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re still taking more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so mad when she finally notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the floor is getting more slippery by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will even get in trouble or if they’ll get away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR
